poem:
"Ode to North Berwick"

Through the whispered morning, away from Edinburgh,
Travels the lullaby of the train, to North Berwick its song.
Elemental and distant, dressed in windswept beauty,
Barefoot along breathless beaches, we belong.
The Scottish coast draws stories from the rocks,
Unearths secrets in panoramic looks. 
Not the West Coast, nor the Highlands – bold, sublime,
Here, in North Berwick, we find time.
